Human Resources Officer Job at Annunciation Specialist Hospital




        
    

        
        Annunciation Specialist Hospital is a faith-based healthcare institution and a Catholic Mission Hospital owned and managed by the Daughters of Divine Love Congregation (DDL). The hospital commenced operations in 1998 with a strong commitment to providing quality, compassionate, and ethical healthcare services rooted in Christian values.
     

            
    



Annunciation Specialist Hospital delivers comprehensive healthcare services through a team of qualified medical, nursing, allied health, and administrative professionals. The hospital is guided by the principles of professionalism, patient-centered care, respect for human dignity, and service to humanity. The hospital is strategically located along Abakaliki Express Road, Emene, Enugu State, making it accessible to residents of Enugu metropolis and surrounding communities.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Officer

Job Location: Emene, Enugu

Job Purpose


	To support effective people management by implementing HR policies, recruitment, employee relations, and compliance processes.


Key Responsibilities


	Coordinate recruitment and onboarding
	Maintain employee records
	Support performance management
	Ensure HR policy compliance
	Handle staff welfare and disciplinary processes.


Minimum Qualifications


	Degree or Diploma in HR, Business Administration, or related fields
	CIPM, SHRM,or CIPD required.


Required Competencies:


	Confidentiality & ethics
	Communication skills
	HR administration
	Problem-solving
	Attention to detail.

HR / Admin Manager Job at Emmittex Agro Industry Limited




        
    

        
        Emmittex Agro Industry Limited (Palm Kernel Oil Mills Division) came into existence with a mission to provide clean and pure indigenous crude palm kernel oil (CPKO) to our teeming Nigerians. The success of this objective is largely in your hands. It is only through your disciplined, efficient, devoted and loyal hardwork that you can boost the health of the company and consequently, your own careers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR / Admin Manager

Job Location: Akwuzu, Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Agro Production / Manufacturing
Gender Preference: Male (for gender balance)

Job Summary
     

            
    




	As our operations expand, we are seeking a competent HR/Admin Manager to lead our Human Resources and Administrative functions, strengthen our internal structure, and support our long-term growth.
	The HR/Admin Manager will oversee all HR and administrative operations of the company, ensuring smooth workflow, compliance, effective people management, and efficient internal coordination.
	This role requires a proactive leader who can manage teams, build strong HR systems, and support management in achieving business objectives.


Key Responsibilities
Human Resources Management:


	Develop and implement HR policies, procedures, and frameworks for the organization.
	Manage the end-to-end recruitment cycle, including job posting, screening, interviewing, onboarding, and documentation.
	Oversee employee orientation, training schedules, and continuous development programs.
	Maintain and update employee records, personnel files, and HR databases accurately.
	Handle employee relations, grievances, conflict resolution, and disciplinary actions professionally.
	Implement performance management systems, KPIs, appraisals, and productivity tracking.
	Monitor staff attendance, leave management, punctuality, and adherence to company standards.
	Promote a positive work culture that aligns with the company’s values and operational goals.
	Ensure compliance with labor laws, health & safety regulations, and statutory HR requirements.


Administrative Management:


	Oversee general office operations, administrative staff, and facility management.
	Ensure proper documentation, filing systems, and information security across the organization.
	Coordinate procurement of office supplies, utilities, and administrative services.
	Manage travel arrangements, logistics, and company events when required.
	Supervise company assets, equipment issuance, and maintenance schedules.
	Support departmental heads with administrative tasks to enhance operational efficiency.


Strategic HR Leadership:


	Advise management on HR policies, workforce planning, and restructuring strategies.
	Analyze HR data and generate reports for decision-making.
	Develop retention strategies to reduce staff turnover and promote employee satisfaction.
	Participate actively in management meetings and organizational planning sessions.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3–5 years of hands-on HR/Admin experience, preferably in a manufacturing or production environment.
	Strong leadership and people-management skills.
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills.
	Proficiency in HR software, MS Office Suite, and basic report writing.
	Strong understanding of Nigerian labor laws and HR compliance standards.


Salary & Benefits


	N200,000 Net monthly
	Accommodation available for the first year.
	Opportunities for career growth and professional development.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: talent.hunt1@yahoo.com using “Application for HR/Admin Manager – Agro Industry” as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

  "description": "Emmittex Agro Industry Limited (Palm Kernel Oil Mills Division) came into existence with a mission to provide clean and pure&nbsp;indigenous crude palm kernel oil (CPKO) to our teeming Nigerians. We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Akwuzu, Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Agro Production / Manufacturing
Availability: Immediate Resumption Preferred
Experience Level: Mid-Level

Job Summary


	As operations expand, we are seeking a skilled Procurement Officer with hands-on experience in a manufacturing or production environment to strengthen our supply chain and ensure seamless procurement of materials, equipment, and services.
	The Procurement Officer will be responsible for sourcing quality materials, negotiating with vendors, managing purchase processes, and ensuring cost-effective procurement that aligns with the company&rsquo;s production goals.
	This role requires someone who understands production workflow, inventory control, and vendor management in a manufacturing environment.


Key Responsibilities
Procurement &amp; Sourcing:


	Identify, evaluate, and engage reliable suppliers for raw materials, packaging materials, equipment, and operational items.
	Obtain quotations, compare pricing, quality, and delivery terms to ensure cost-effective purchasing.
	Develop and maintain strong vendor relationships to support consistent supply flow.
	Conduct routine supplier performance evaluations and recommend improvements.


Purchase Management:


	Raise purchase orders and follow up until complete delivery is achieved.
	Ensure timely procurement to avoid production downtime or stock-outs.
	Track purchase requisitions from all departments and ensure proper authorization before processing.
	Maintain accurate records of all purchases, invoices, and payment receipts.


Inventory &amp; Stock Control:


	Work closely with the storekeeper and production team to determine stock levels, reorder quantities, and material usage patterns.
	Monitor inventory movements to ensure optimal stock levels at all times.
	Prevent waste, pilferage, and overstocking through proper planning and tracking.


Cost &amp; Quality Management:


	Negotiate contract terms, pricing, and supply agreements in line with company objectives.
	Ensure all procured materials meet quality standards required for production.
	Identify cost-saving opportunities without compromising quality.


Cross-Department Collaboration:


	Work with Accounts, Production, Maintenance, and Admin departments for seamless workflow.
	Support production planning by providing accurate updates on material availability.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Procurement, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2&ndash;4 years of procurement experience in a manufacturing or production environment (MUST HAVE).
	Strong negotiation and vendor management skills.
	Solid understanding of stock control, production materials, and supply chain processes.
	Proficient in Microsoft Excel and basic inventory management tools.
	Excellent communication, documentation, and organizational abilities.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
	High level of integrity and attention to detail.


Salary &amp; Benefits


	N130,000 monthly
	Monthly Bonus structure (Based on Supply target)
	Opportunity for career growth within the company.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;talent.hunt1@yahoo.com&nbsp;using &#39;&#39;Application for Procurement Officer &ndash; Agro Production&quot; as the subject of the mail.

	Develop and maintain strong vendor relationships to support consistent supply flow.
	Conduct routine supplier performance evaluations and recommend improvements.

	Ensure timely procurement to avoid production downtime or stock-outs.
	Track purchase requisitions from all departments and ensure proper authorization before processing.
	Maintain accurate records of all purchases, invoices, and payment receipts.

	Work closely with the storekeeper and production team to determine stock levels, reorder quantities, and material usage patterns.
	Monitor inventory movements to ensure optimal stock levels at all times.
